newsitem.title: EGYPT: Japan gives Egypt $12 mln for fishing port.
newsitem.headline: Japan gives Egypt $12 mln for fishing port.

text.p: Japan agreed on Wednesday to give Egypt 1.26 billion yen ($11.6 million) to develop a fishing port on the Mediterranean coast.
The project includes building breakwaters, quays and other facilities for Maadia port, some 30 km (20 miles) east of the Mediterranean city of Alexandria.
Japanese Foreign Minister Yukihiko Ikeda, on a three-day visit to Egypt, signed the aid agreement, with Economy and International Cooperation Minister Nawal el-Tatawi for Egypt.
The grant brings cumulative Japanese assistance to Egypt to 95.45 billion yen, the Japanese embassy said in a press release.
Ikeda, who arrived late on Tuesday, will meet resident Hosni Mubarak and the two are expected to discuss possible Japanese finance for a $140 million bridge over the Suez Canal.
